actions.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance.

official_title: A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to make deduction for health insurance costs of self-employed individuals permanent, and to provide for a phased-in increase in the deductible amount of health insurance costs from 25 to 100 percent.
short_title: Health Benefits for Self-Employed Individuals Act of 1992

summary.text: Health Benefits for Self-Employed Individuals Act of 1992 - Amends Internal Revenue Code provisions governing the income tax deduction for the health insurance costs of self-employed individuals to: (1) make the deduction permanent (under current law it will expire after June 30, 1992); and (2) phase in an increase in the allowable deduction, reaching 100 percent for taxable years beginning in 1996 and thereafter.

titles.title: Health Benefits for Self-Employed Individuals Act of 1992

A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to make deduction for health insurance costs of self-employed individuals permanent, and to provide for a phased-in increase in the deductible amount of health insurance costs from 25 to 100 percent.
